resources.string: See the Git repo for email addresses.
Number of rows of whole-step keys to include for each octave.
Hexiano™, copyright © 2012 by James Haigh, and 2011, 2012 by David A. Randolph.
Enter percentage to scale keys. Default = 100. Smaller numbers shrink keys. Larger numbers expand them.
What labels do you want to see on the keys?
What colours do you want to see?
What sounds do you want to hear?
Do you want to play looking at a landscape (wide) display?
What note arrangement on the keys do you want to use?
The octave of the highest note to include.
The lowest playable note to include.
The highest playable note to include.
The octave of the lowest playable note to include.
Play adjacent notes with one finger (4ths and 5ths).

Hexiano is an Open-source isomorphic musical keyboard. All intervals, chords, and scales have identical patterns, regardless of the key in which one plays. Hexiano aims to deliver the isomorphic keyboard concept to Android users. See http://www.altkeyboards.com/ for more information about these instruments.
Source code for Hexiano is available at https://gitorious.org/hexiano under the terms of GNU General Public License (version 3).

This program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by the Free Software Foundation; either version 3 of the License, or (at your option) any later version. This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. For the complete license, see http://www.gnu.org/licenses/.

Sounds from the acoustic grand piano soundfont (Yamaha Disklavier Pro), release 2008-09-10, by Roberto Gordo Saez (roberto.gordo@gmail.com), were adapted for use in Hexiano. (See http://zenvoid.org/audio.html.) Specifically, we translated a set of files (mostly from the third velocity layer) from the soundfont into Ogg Vorbis format, with a rather drastic loss of fidelity. Please do not take the Hexiano piano sound as representative of the quality of this excellent soundfont. It just helped to start from a high-quality source.
This soundfont was built using the Zenph Studios Yamaha Disklavier Pro Piano Multisamples for OLPC, which was created by Dr. Mikhail Krishtal, Director of Music Research and Production, and his team at Zenph Studios.
Neither Dr. Krishtal nor Mr. Saez in any way endorses Hexiano. Their work is used under the terms of the Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 license. See http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0 for details.

To improve the quality of our application, we reserve the right to track and report user activity inside IsoKeys. All data collected will be anonymous. We respect your privacy and will not collect any information to identify you personally.
Horizontal keys "point up and down"; vertical keys "point left and right."
